values.description:
Updates the noise models to have dynamic bias as well as update the IMU to use the noise models.

‌

Note that this adds a second argument to the `Noise::Apply` method to pass dt. This is necessary for time-correlated noise. I have given it a default value of 0.0, which means that time-correlated noise won’t be applied unless a sensor correctly passes in dt \(available thru updateRate\).
values.title: [Blueprint] Update IMU Noise Models

summary.raw:
Updates the noise models to have dynamic bias as well as update the IMU to use the noise models.

‌

Note that this adds a second argument to the `Noise::Apply` method to pass dt. This is necessary for time-correlated noise. I have given it a default value of 0.0, which means that time-correlated noise won’t be applied unless a sensor correctly passes in dt \(available thru updateRate\).
summary.html:
Updates the noise models to have dynamic bias as well as update the IMU to use the noise models.

‌

Note that this adds a second argument to the Noise::Apply method to pass dt. This is necessary for time-correlated noise. I have given it a default value of 0.0, which means that time-correlated noise won’t be applied unless a sensor correctly passes in dt (available thru updateRate).

values.description:
The [SDF spec](http://sdformat.org/spec?ver=1.6&elem=sensor#sensor_update_rate) considers an unspecified update rate to be zero and that means the sensor is updated at every cycle (i.e. as fast as possible).

Without this PR, ign-sensors was dividing by zero for unspecified rates :boom:

---

Also added a quick fix for GPU lidars to work. Since `GpuLidar::Load` calls `Lidar::Load`, the `Lidar` class should accept `GPU_LIDAR` as a valid sensor type.

---

Also made `Sensor::SetParent` virtual, otherwise `Lidar::SetParent` was not being called on `ign-gazebo`.
values.title: [Blueprint] Zero update rate

summary.raw:
The [SDF spec](http://sdformat.org/spec?ver=1.6&elem=sensor#sensor_update_rate) considers an unspecified update rate to be zero and that means the sensor is updated at every cycle (i.e. as fast as possible).

Without this PR, ign-sensors was dividing by zero for unspecified rates :boom:

---

Also added a quick fix for GPU lidars to work. Since `GpuLidar::Load` calls `Lidar::Load`, the `Lidar` class should accept `GPU_LIDAR` as a valid sensor type.

---

Also made `Sensor::SetParent` virtual, otherwise `Lidar::SetParent` was not being called on `ign-gazebo`.
summary.html:
The SDF spec considers an unspecified update rate to be zero and that means the sensor is updated at every cycle (i.e. as fast as possible).

Without this PR, ign-sensors was dividing by zero for unspecified rates

Also added a quick fix for GPU lidars to work. Since GpuLidar::Load calls Lidar::Load, the Lidar class should accept GPU_LIDAR as a valid sensor type.

Also made Sensor::SetParent virtual, otherwise Lidar::SetParent was not being called on ign-gazebo.

values.description:
** Post Blueprint release**

This adds an RGBD camera sensor that effectively combines a CameraSensor, DepthCameraSensor, and also outputs a pointcloud. The intent is to move the capabilities of `https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/blob/kinetic-devel/gazebo_plugins/src/gazebo_ros_openni_kinect.cpp` from a ROS plugin directly into simulation.

There are a number of things I'd like to improve, such as creating new sdf elements to better support this type of camera. However, these improvements won't get into Blueprint.

So, for now a few things are hard-coded including the far clip of the depth camera and pixel formats. The depth image is also forced to be the same size as the 2D RGB image.

I chose not to modify the existing `DepthCameraSensor` because I did not want to change the behavior of an existing sensor, and I can see the need for a sensor that only produces a depth image.
values.title: Rgbd sensor

summary.raw:
** Post Blueprint release**

This adds an RGBD camera sensor that effectively combines a CameraSensor, DepthCameraSensor, and also outputs a pointcloud. The intent is to move the capabilities of `https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/blob/kinetic-devel/gazebo_plugins/src/gazebo_ros_openni_kinect.cpp` from a ROS plugin directly into simulation.

There are a number of things I'd like to improve, such as creating new sdf elements to better support this type of camera. However, these improvements won't get into Blueprint.

So, for now a few things are hard-coded including the far clip of the depth camera and pixel formats. The depth image is also forced to be the same size as the 2D RGB image.

I chose not to modify the existing `DepthCameraSensor` because I did not want to change the behavior of an existing sensor, and I can see the need for a sensor that only produces a depth image.
summary.html:
Post Blueprint release

This adds an RGBD camera sensor that effectively combines a CameraSensor, DepthCameraSensor, and also outputs a pointcloud. The intent is to move the capabilities of https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/blob/kinetic-devel/gazebo_plugins/src/gazebo_ros_openni_kinect.cpp from a ROS plugin directly into simulation.

There are a number of things I'd like to improve, such as creating new sdf elements to better support this type of camera. However, these improvements won't get into Blueprint.

So, for now a few things are hard-coded including the far clip of the depth camera and pixel formats. The depth image is also forced to be the same size as the 2D RGB image.

I chose not to modify the existing DepthCameraSensor because I did not want to change the behavior of an existing sensor, and I can see the need for a sensor that only produces a depth image.

values.description:
Currently, given a `<topic>rgbd</topic>` , the rgbd camera publishes on the following topics

* `/rgbd/image`
* `/rgbd/depth_image`
* `/camera_info`

This PR changes the last one to be `/rgbd/camera_info`
values.title: Fix camera_info topic to be on the same level as image and depth_image

summary.raw:
Currently, given a `<topic>rgbd</topic>` , the rgbd camera publishes on the following topics

* `/rgbd/image`
* `/rgbd/depth_image`
* `/camera_info`

This PR changes the last one to be `/rgbd/camera_info`
summary.html:
Currently, given a <topic>rgbd</topic> , the rgbd camera publishes on the following topics

  • /rgbd/image
  • /rgbd/depth_image
  • /camera_info

This PR changes the last one to be /rgbd/camera_info

values.description: Currently, the `frame` of a LaserScan message is set to the name of the parent SDF element of the sensor. This PR changes it so it uses the name of the sensor element itself. This conforms to how the `frame_id` is set in the header of a `LaserScan` message on [Line 200]( #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors/src/0b56cac7ca0ff4d4d3a8e59a2a5a17b0f6add552/src/Lidar.cc#lines-200).
values.title: GPU Lidar: Use the sensor's name as the frame_id

summary.raw: Currently, the `frame` of a LaserScan message is set to the name of the parent SDF element of the sensor. This PR changes it so it uses the name of the sensor element itself. This conforms to how the `frame_id` is set in the header of a `LaserScan` message on [Line 200]( #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors/src/0b56cac7ca0ff4d4d3a8e59a2a5a17b0f6add552/src/Lidar.cc#lines-200).
summary.html: Currently, the frame of a LaserScan message is set to the name of the parent SDF element of the sensor. This PR changes it so it uses the name of the sensor element itself. This conforms to how the frame_id is set in the header of a LaserScan message on Line 200.

values.description:
Added functions to enable sensor's scene update to be done manually for performance reasons. Currently all rendering sensor updates will call `rendering::Scene::PreRender` to update the scene graph before the actual render operation. This is inefficient when there are multiple sensors in the scene. Setting the manual scene update mode gives the flexibility of performing a scene update only once per frame before making the sensor render calls.

Note that there are existing test failures and should be fixed by [ign-rendering pull request #180](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/180/fix-scene-cleanup/diff)
values.title: Support manual scene updates for rendering sensors

summary.raw:
Added functions to enable sensor's scene update to be done manually for performance reasons. Currently all rendering sensor updates will call `rendering::Scene::PreRender` to update the scene graph before the actual render operation. This is inefficient when there are multiple sensors in the scene. Setting the manual scene update mode gives the flexibility of performing a scene update only once per frame before making the sensor render calls.

Note that there are existing test failures and should be fixed by [ign-rendering pull request #180](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/180/fix-scene-cleanup/diff)
summary.html:
Added functions to enable sensor's scene update to be done manually for performance reasons. Currently all rendering sensor updates will call rendering::Scene::PreRender to update the scene graph before the actual render operation. This is inefficient when there are multiple sensors in the scene. Setting the manual scene update mode gives the flexibility of performing a scene update only once per frame before making the sensor render calls.

Note that there are existing test failures and should be fixed by ign-rendering pull request #180

values.description:
This PR follows the pattern of #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/96/

Results below also use #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/400/

Here are some interesting results from running some SubT practice tunnels with a single robot. Each time the robot is different, to use different sensors.

## Camera

![sensors_profiler.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/da5rgr4/images/2466379935-sensors_profiler.png)

A big chunk of camera update time is on `camera->Copy`

## 2D lidar

![laserscan.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/da5rgr4/images/167263056-laserscan.png)

When the lidar is only publishing laser scans, the big chunk of time is spent on `Render`

## 3D lidar

![pointcloud_lidar.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/da5rgr4/images/199818578-pointcloud_lidar.png)

Then the lidar is publishing point clouds, the time to `FillPointCloud` is noticeable, but still small comparing to `Render`

## RGBD camera

![rgbd.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/da5rgr4/images/3024939210-rgbd.png)

The RGBD camera combines all worst cases in one. It has `Render`, `camera->Copy` and `FillPointCloud`
values.title: Enable profiler

summary.html:
This PR follows the pattern of #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/96/

Results below also use #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/400/

Here are some interesting results from running some SubT practice tunnels with a single robot. Each time the robot is different, to use different sensors.

Camera

A big chunk of camera update time is on camera->Copy

2D lidar

When the lidar is only publishing laser scans, the big chunk of time is spent on Render

3D lidar

Then the lidar is publishing point clouds, the time to FillPointCloud is noticeable, but still small comparing to Render

RGBD camera

The RGBD camera combines all worst cases in one. It has Render, camera->Copy and FillPointCloud

values.title: Deduplicate frame_ids from sensor message headers

summary.html:
The Lidar and LogicalCamera sensors reuse message variables to improve performance, but the data entries need to be cleared before adding new ones to avoid repeated entries.

Before this PR, the header of a Lidar message after a few iterations looks like this:

header {
  stamp {
    sec: 93
    nsec: 52000000
  }
  data {
    key: "frame_id"
    value: "R2::base_link::front_laser"
  }
  data {
    key: "frame_id"
    value: "R2::base_link::front_laser"
  }
  data {
    key: "frame_id"
    value: "R2::base_link::front_laser"
  }
  data {
    key: "frame_id"
    value: "R2::base_link::front_laser"
  }
...

There should only be one 

  data {
    key: "frame_id"
    value: "R2::base_link::front_laser"
  }

values.description:
The projection matrix for stereo cameras needs to take the distance between them into account to properly translate points, see the [camera_info](http://wiki.ros.org/image_pipeline/CameraInfo) docs.

On `gazebo_ros_pkgs`, that was exposed as the `hack_baseline` element on [gazebo_ros_camera](https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/blob/kinetic-devel/gazebo_plugins/src/gazebo_ros_camera_utils.cpp#L191). SDF doesn't expose that parameter yet, so this adds a setter and getter for the property, so that consumers like `ign-gazebo` can set it after the camera has been loaded.

Once `ign-sensors` has support for `multicamera`, we may choose to deprecate this on regular cameras, or leave it since it's zero by default.
values.title: Baseline for stereo cameras

summary.raw:
The projection matrix for stereo cameras needs to take the distance between them into account to properly translate points, see the [camera_info](http://wiki.ros.org/image_pipeline/CameraInfo) docs.

On `gazebo_ros_pkgs`, that was exposed as the `hack_baseline` element on [gazebo_ros_camera](https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/blob/kinetic-devel/gazebo_plugins/src/gazebo_ros_camera_utils.cpp#L191). SDF doesn't expose that parameter yet, so this adds a setter and getter for the property, so that consumers like `ign-gazebo` can set it after the camera has been loaded.

Once `ign-sensors` has support for `multicamera`, we may choose to deprecate this on regular cameras, or leave it since it's zero by default.
summary.html:
The projection matrix for stereo cameras needs to take the distance between them into account to properly translate points, see the camera_info docs.

On gazebo_ros_pkgs, that was exposed as the hack_baseline element on gazebo_ros_camera. SDF doesn't expose that parameter yet, so this adds a setter and getter for the property, so that consumers like ign-gazebo can set it after the camera has been loaded.

Once ign-sensors has support for multicamera, we may choose to deprecate this on regular cameras, or leave it since it's zero by default.

values.description:
Addresses [this issue](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/subt/issues/153/simulated-lidar-does-not-include-ring).

The plugin on `gazebo_ros_pkgs` was not populating `ring` information, but the [GazeboRosVelodyneLaser](https://bitbucket.org/DataspeedInc/velodyne_simulator/src/506664dd478984aa6645d8210802a4a7ddc40629/velodyne_gazebo_plugins/src/GazeboRosVelodyneLaser.cpp#lines-269) plugin does.

The intensities are all zero right now. I don't think `ign-rendering` currently supports `<laser_retro>`, but please correct me if I'm wrong, @{557058:10b01d41-a2e9-4a41-a907-e6e2f03b6cd5} .

The rings can be visualized on RViz using [this](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/419/vertical-rays-for-lidar-demo/diff) `ign-gazebo` PR and `ros1_ign_gazebo_demo`:

`roslaunch ros1_ign_gazebo_demos gpu_lidar_bridge.launch`

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/da5rgr4/images/1129031518-lidardemo.png)
values.title: Lidar intensity and ring

summary.raw:
Addresses [this issue](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/subt/issues/153/simulated-lidar-does-not-include-ring).

The plugin on `gazebo_ros_pkgs` was not populating `ring` information, but the [GazeboRosVelodyneLaser](https://bitbucket.org/DataspeedInc/velodyne_simulator/src/506664dd478984aa6645d8210802a4a7ddc40629/velodyne_gazebo_plugins/src/GazeboRosVelodyneLaser.cpp#lines-269) plugin does.

The intensities are all zero right now. I don't think `ign-rendering` currently supports `<laser_retro>`, but please correct me if I'm wrong, @{557058:10b01d41-a2e9-4a41-a907-e6e2f03b6cd5} .

The rings can be visualized on RViz using [this](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/419/vertical-rays-for-lidar-demo/diff) `ign-gazebo` PR and `ros1_ign_gazebo_demo`:

`roslaunch ros1_ign_gazebo_demos gpu_lidar_bridge.launch`

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/da5rgr4/images/1129031518-lidardemo.png)
summary.html:
Addresses this issue.

The plugin on gazebo_ros_pkgs was not populating ring information, but the GazeboRosVelodyneLaser plugin does.

The intensities are all zero right now. I don't think ign-rendering currently supports <laser_retro>, but please correct me if I'm wrong, @Ian Chen .

The rings can be visualized on RViz using this ign-gazebo PR and ros1_ign_gazebo_demo:

roslaunch ros1_ign_gazebo_demos gpu_lidar_bridge.launch

values.description:
Depends on [ign-rendering pull request 187](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/187/support-generating-point-cloud-data-in/diff)

Replaces pull request #80 - I branched from there but made many changes afterwards so the diff may get confusing if I target that branch.

Updated the depth and rgbd camera sensors to connect to the new point cloud event from ign-rendering’s DepthCamera. Point cloud data are now generated in the shaders and not on CPU.

Also added a rgbd camera integration test. In addition to checking that the values are valid, it also compares the new xyz data generated by the shaders against those manually converted from depth data to make sure they are consistent.

Here are performance profiling results done in subt in a tunnel environment with X3 Config 4 robot \(1 VGA RGBD camera\):

**Before:** Sensor::Update 17.57ms

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/da5rgr4/images/2061576688-rgbd_before.png)
**After:** Sensor::Update 5.71ms

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/da5rgr4/images/461834678-rgbd_after.png)
values.title: Update depth and rgbd camera sensor to output point cloud data generated by ign-rendering DepthCamera

Updated the depth and rgbd camera sensors to connect to the new point cloud event from ign-rendering’s DepthCamera. Point cloud data are now generated in the shaders and not on CPU.

Also added a rgbd camera integration test. In addition to checking that the values are valid, it also compares the new xyz data generated by the shaders against those manually converted from depth data to make sure they are consistent.

Here are performance profiling results done in subt in a tunnel environment with X3 Config 4 robot \(1 VGA RGBD camera\):

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/da5rgr4/images/461834678-rgbd_after.png)
summary.html:

Replaces pull request #80 - I branched from there but made many changes afterwards so the diff may get confusing if I target that branch.

Updated the depth and rgbd camera sensors to connect to the new point cloud event from ign-rendering’s DepthCamera. Point cloud data are now generated in the shaders and not on CPU.

Also added a rgbd camera integration test. In addition to checking that the values are valid, it also compares the new xyz data generated by the shaders against those manually converted from depth data to make sure they are consistent.

Here are performance profiling results done in subt in a tunnel environment with X3 Config 4 robot (1 VGA RGBD camera):

After: Sensor::Update 5.71ms

values.description:
There was a `using namespace ignition;` statement in sdf/Lidar.hh, but this was recently removed in [osrf/sdformat pr 577](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/577/lidarhh-remove-using-namespace-ignition/diff), and there were a couple of tests that now fail to compile against the `sdf8` branch:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign_sensors-ign-2-win&build=23)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_sensors-ign-2-win/23/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_sensors-ign-2-win/23/
values.title: Add missing using namespace ignition statements to tests
